text: Share Copied As of June 16, Brazil has over 890,000 confirmed COVID-19 cases and 44,000 deaths, with a 60-percent occupancy rate of intensive care beds. Bruno, a Brazilian doctor and team leader at the field hospital of Rio de Janeiro prefecture, is on the front line treating an average of 200 patients a day. Despite witnessing pain and death, Bruno says the pandemic is providing lessons of love. Copyright © 2020 CGTN. Beijing ICP prepared NO.16065310-3 Copyright © 2020 CGTN. title: Brazilian doctor: 'We have passed the worst stage' - CGTN
